title: Commuter horror as man is killed when he slips and falls into the path of a freight train
text:
A man has died after he fell onto railway tracks and was hit by a freight train in south Sydney.

Emergency workers were called to Rockdale Railway Station at about 7pm on Thursday after the 54-year-old lost his footing on the platform and fell into the path of the train.

Police said the man got off the train and walked to the end of the platform.

He was standing close to its edge when he fell.

A man has died after he fell onto railway tracks and was hit by a freight train in Rockdale (pictured)

Emergency workers were called to Rockdale Railway Station about 7pm on Thursday after the 54-year-old lost his footing on the platform and fell into the path of the train (scene pictured)

Officers from St George Area Command, Police Transport and NSW Ambulance paramedics attended the scene.

He died at the scene despite efforts to revive him.

Train services were delayed between Wolli Creek and Hurstville.

A coroner report will be prepared.
description: The 54-year-old lost his footing on Rockdale Railway Station in Sydney and fell into the path of the train.
authors: Charlotte Karp For Daily Mail Australia
